bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, December 17, 1947

div1.p: Hench informs Nogueira that he will be unable to obtain American support for the Camp Lazear memorial until the Cubans make a firm commitment to maintain it. He would like to meet with the Cuban president when he visits Cuba in March.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, December 17, 1947
div1.opener:
December 17, 1947
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
Medico Cirujano
Marti 219, Marianao
Habana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Nogueira:
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly indeed for your letter of November 14 addressed
to me in care of Doctor Strode at the Rockefeller Foundation in New York. It
arrived just five minutes before I was to leave for my conference with Mr.
Rockefeller's representative. I appreciate greatly the information which you
gave me but I find it very difficult to obtain American support until such time
as we can know just how much, if any, support we can receive from the Cuban
Government, or Cuban medical circle in the matter of taking care of the little
memorial once funds have been raised for it. I do not believe I could get
very far in my campaign until I know the answere to more of the questions
originally mentioned in my letter to you of May 16.

In order that this matter can be furthered, I should like to plan
to come to Cuba the first week in March. I have written for reservations at
the Hotel Nacional and hope to see you and others whom you might wish me to
see. Would it be possible for me to enlist the approval of your President,
Dr. Ramon Grau San Martin? Would it be suitable for me to request you to ar-
range a brief interview. I would like to have the privilege of having Mr. John
J. Moran present as he known the entire background of my proposals.
I await with pleasure your reply.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
